text: First marathon: Scenes from Detroit and Windsor Finishing the Free Press Marathon was a culmination of months of training, encouragement. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs First marathon: Scenes from Detroit and Windsor Dan Dean 2:23 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Selfie from our Ren Cen room at the Marriott with a view of the Ambassador Bridge on Saturday evening. About 13 hours later I would run across the same bridge. Dan Dean Waiting in the starting corral Sunday morning. Dan Dean We are off, soon to pass under the start line. Dan Dean Passing by a couple of women early on dressed as Rosie the Riveter. Dan Dean Winding our way up the Ambassador Bridge. Dan Dean A couple of Hope Water runners making their way down the Canadian side of the bridge. Dan Dean Entering Canada under the watchful eye of the Border Patrol officers. Dan Dean Along Riverside in Windsor were some of the funniest signs including this one, keeping the mood light. Dan Dean Encouragement provided by onlookers along Riverside in Windsor. Dan Dean Another sign along Riverside in Windsor. Many folks personalized signs for family members or friends. Dan Dean A constant worry of long distance runners in the category of too much information. Dan Dean On our way through Windsor. Dan Dean Shouting out encouragement while running through Windsor. Dan Dean U.S. Border Patrol officers line the tunnel on the way back out onto Jefferson. Dan Dean Not all business: Border Patrol officers offer encouragement to passing runners. Dan Dean A sign welcomes us back into Detroit Dan Dean Observer & Eccentric assistant managing editor Dan Dean enters Jefferson Avenue after crossing back into the U.S. through the tunnel. Cathy Dean Runners make their way along Jefferson toward Cobo Center. Dan Dean It will be a longtime before we see the Ren Cen again. Dan Dean Onlookers watch us and shout encouragement as we run underneath Cobo Center. Dan Dean Making our way along the Lodge Freeway - the People Mover crosses overhead. Dan Dean Onlookers cheer from a freeway overpass. Dan Dean Passing King Books at around mile 9. Dan Dean A water station volunteer uses a megaphone to shout encouragement at 91/2 miles. Dan Dean Volunteers from Hope Water Project hand out water and Gatorade. Dan Dean A fluid station volunteers hands out Gatorade. Dan Dean Supporters from the Hope Water Project cheer on the runners. Dan Dean Heading back towards downtown along Bagley in Mexican Town. Dan Dean An onlooker with an encouraging sign in Detroit. Dan Dean High-spirited encouragement around the mile 11 or 12 mark. Dan Dean Make-A-Wish volunteers cheer runners on along Michigan Avenue just after mile 12. Dan Dean We saw a lot of things, but only this couple took time out from running to dance to the music blaring along Griswold Street as we we made our way to the halfway point. Dan Dean If water or Gatorade did not float your boat, there were plenty of other options offered along the way, including shots of Jim Beam Dan Dean Cheering as we approach the halfway mark downtown. Dan Dean Some serious cheering along Congress, just before the halfway mark downtown. Dan Dean Selfie at the halfway point along Congress downtown. Dan Dean As we headed out of downtown along Lafayette, things got a bit lonely. An occasional sign holder would cheer us on. Dan Dean Somewhere between miles 17 and 18, along Burns, you had a choice to run through the wall. Dan Dean A band plays and others dance along Burns in Indian Village. Dan Dean Late morning sun casts long shadows at the General Williams statue on Belle Isle at about mile 20. Dan Dean First view of Ren Cen since coming out of the tunnel at mile 8 was a welcome sight at mile 21. Dan Dean We are getting close as we make our way along the RiverWalk around mile 24. Dan Dean We are on at Atwater at mile 25 on our way to the finish line. Dan Dean Heading to the finish line on Fort Street. Karen Dean Back at the Hope Water Project tent with fresh shirt and my finisher medal. Dan Dean Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
